title: NDTV News-World-news
description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

entries.title: US Court Halts Trump's 2020 Election Interference Case
entries.description: A Georgia appeals court on Wednesday froze all proceedings in the election interference case against former US president Donald Trump and his co-defendants in the southern state.

entries.title: Russia Could Use Nuclear Weapons If...: Putin Warns West
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin, asked about the risks of nuclear war over Ukraine, cautioned the West on Wednesday that Russia could use all available means to defend itself if its sovereignty or territorial integrity were threatened.

entries.title: 4 Killed, Dozens Injured In Trains Crash In Czech Republic
entries.description: Four people died and dozens were injured when an express train crashed with a freight train in the Czech city of Pardubice late on Wednesday, rescuers said.

entries.title: WHO Confirms First Human Death Of Bird Flu In Mexico
entries.description: The World Health Organization said Wednesday a person in Mexico had died in the first confirmed human case globally of infection with the H5N2 variant of bird flu.

entries.title: Slovak PM Blames Opposition For Assassination Attempt Against Him
entries.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico has said here that he did not believe last month's assassination attempt against him was carried out by a lone madman.

entries.title: Russia Has No "Imperial" Ambitions, Does Not Plan To Attack NATO: Putin
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday told a meeting of foreign news outlets that Moscow harbours no "imperial ambitions" and dismissed as "bollocks" the idea that Russia could attack NATO.

entries.title: Putin Calls For Russia To "Build Up" Ties With Taliban Government
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday called for Moscow to "build up" relations with the Taliban government, as a delegation visited Russia.

entries.title: Yemen's Houthi Rebels Target 3 Vessels In Red Sea, Arabian Sea
entries.description: Yemen's Houthis conducted military operations targeting three vessels in the Red Sea and the Arabian Sea, the group's military spokesperson Yahya Saree said on Wednesday.

entries.title: Western Arms Deliveries To Ukraine "Very Dangerous Step": Putin
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday warned that Western arms deliveries to Ukraine were "a very dangerous step", especially if donors are "controlling" use of the weapons.

entries.title: Putin Says He Doesn't Expect Policy Change By US After Presidential Election
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that he did not expect any major changes in U.S. policy towards Russia if Donald Trump wins the presidency in November, but did not rule out a shift in thinking.

entries.title: All You Need To Know About 2 Astronauts Onboard Starliner Space Flight
entries.description: Two veteran NASA astronauts with 500 days of previous spaceflight experience between them are the first crew of Boeing's pxpCST-100 Starliner space capsule, launched to space in a test flight on Wednesday from Florida.

entries.title: Is Donald Trump Eligible To Own Gun After His Conviction In Hush Money?
entries.description: Donald Trump is expected to receive the Republican presidential nomination at the party's convention in Milwaukee, which is to begin just four days after his July 11 sentencing in New York for his conviction on 34 felony counts

entries.title: US Says Decision To Announce Gaza Truce Deal Unilaterally Was Deliberate
entries.description: When U.S. President Joe Biden publicly aired a Gaza ceasefire proposal developed by Israel and the United States and sent to Hamas, he made the announcement without seeking agreement from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu

entries.title: "Feel No Hatred": Slovak PM In First Appearance After Assassination Attempt
entries.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico spoke in a video posted on Wednesday for the first time since being shot and wounded in an assassination attempt against him last month.

entries.title: Sunita Williams Scripts History As She Rockets Into Space Onboard Starliner
entries.description: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams rocketed into space creating history as the first woman to test a spacecraft on its maiden mission, which she incidentally helped design over the last decade. Ms Williams overflew India on her way to space.

entries.title: UN Nuclear Watchdog Resolution Calls On Iran To Step Up Its Cooperation
entries.description: The U.N. nuclear watchdog's 35-nation Board of Governors passed a resolution on Wednesday calling on Iran to step up cooperation with the watchdog and reverse its recent barring of inspectors despite concerns Tehran would respond with atomic

entries.title: Starlink Brings Internet To Remote Tribe. They Get Hooked To Porn
entries.description: In the dense Amazon rainforest, which stretches for thousands of miles, lives an Indigenous, remote tribe that speaks its language, and has a different culture preserved for several millennia.

entries.title: 2024 May Was Hottest On Record Globally, 12 Month In A Row: EU Monitor
entries.description: Last month was the hottest May on record and was the 12th consecutive month of historic heat on Earth, the EU climate monitor announced Wednesday.

entries.title: Indian-Origin Astronaut Sunita Williams Flies To Space On Boeing Starliner
entries.description: Boeing on Wednesday launched its very first astronauts bound for the International Space Station aboard a Starliner capsule, which joins a select club of spacecraft to carry humans beyond Earth.

entries.title: US Tests Hypersonic Missile Capable Of Striking Moscow Within 30 Minutes
entries.description: Collaborating with Space Force guardians, the launch aimed to validate the safety, security, effectiveness, and readiness of the weapon system.
